DeepMatter.viz package¶

Submodules¶

DeepMatter.viz.embeddings module¶

viz.embeddings.embedding_maps(data, image, colorbar_shown=True, c_lim=None, mod=None, title=None)[source]¶
Parameters

  • data (array) – data need to be showed in image format

  • image (array) – the output shape of the image

  • colorbar_shown (boolean) – whether to show the color bar on the left of image

  • c_lim (list) – Sets the scales of colorbar

  • mod (int) – set the number of image for each line

  • title (string) – set the title of figure

Returns

handel to figure being created

Return type

matplotlib figure

DeepMatter.viz.format module¶

viz.format.add_colorbar(plt_, ax, pos='right', size='10%', pad=0.05)[source]¶
Parameters

  • plt (matplotlib plots) – mg that add the colorbar

  • ax (matplotlib ax) – subplot of the img that added the colorbar

  • pos (string) – the position of the colorbar we put, default is ‘right’

  • size (string) – the size the colorbar

  • pad (float) – the distance between the colorbar and the figure

viz.format.add_in_figure_title(ax, text_string, vertical_shift=0.02)[source]¶
Parameters

  • ax (matplotlib ax) – img that need to add the title

  • text_string (string) – string need to be added

  • vertical_shift (float) – the position shift where put the string

viz.format.labelfigs(axes, number, style='wb', loc='br', string_add='', size=20, text_pos='center')[source]¶

Adds labels to figures

Parameters

  • axes (matplotlib axes) – axes which to add the plot to

  • number (int) – letter number

  • style (str, optional) – sets the color of the letters

  • loc (str, optional) – sets the location of the label

  • string_add (str, optional) – custom string as the label

  • size (int, optional) – sets the font size for the label

  • text_pos (str, optional) – set the justification of the label

viz.format.layout_fig(graph, mod=None, x=1, y=1)[source]¶
Parameters

  • graph (int) – number of axes to make

  • mod (int (, optional)) – sets the number of figures per row

  • x (float) – set the size of figures in x axis

  • y (float) – set the size of figures in y axis

Returns

output figures

Return type

matplot plots

viz.format.rotate_and_crop(image_, angle=60.46, frac_rm=0.17765042979942694)[source]¶

function to rotate the image

Parameters

  • image (array) – image array to plot

  • angle (float (, optional)) – angle to rotate the image by

  • frac_rm (float (, optional)) – sets the fraction of the image to remove

Returns

crop_image:

image which is rotated and cropped

scale_factor:

scaling factor for the image following rotation

Return type

crop_image:

array

scale_factor:

float

DeepMatter.viz.movies module¶

viz.movies.make_movie(movie_name, input_folder, output_folder, file_format, fps, output_format='mp4', reverse=False)[source]¶

function that makes the movie of the images data

Parameters

  • movie_name (string) – name of the movie

  • input_folder (string) – folder where the image series is located

  • output_folder (string) – folder where the movie will be saved

  • file_format (string) – sets the format of the files to import

  • fps (numpy, int) – frames per second

  • output_format (string (, optional)) – sets the format for the output file supported types .mp4 and gif animated gif create large files

  • reverse (bool (, optional)) – sets if the movie will be one way of there and back
